description:
The `metrics` ping is intended for all of the metrics that are explicitly
set by the application or are included in the application's `metrics.yaml`
file (except events).
The reported data is tied to the ping's *measurement window*, which is the
time between the collection of two `metrics` ping. Ideally, this window is
expected to be about 24 hours, given that the collection is scheduled daily
at 4AM. Data in the `ping_info` section of the ping can be used to infer the
length of this window.

reasons.overdue:
The last ping wasn't submitted on the current calendar day, but it's after
4am, so this ping submitted immediately
reasons.reschedule:
A ping was just submitted. This ping was rescheduled for the next calendar
day at 4am.
reasons.today:
The last ping wasn't submitted on the current calendar day, but it is
still before 4am, so schedule to send this ping on the current calendar
day at 4am.
reasons.tomorrow:
The last ping was already submitted on the current calendar day, so
schedule this ping for the next calendar day at 4am.
reasons.upgrade:
This ping was submitted at startup because the application was just
upgraded.

name: metrics

metrics.name: addons.enabled_addons
metrics.description: A list of all enabled add-ons on the device.

metrics.name: addons.has_enabled_addons
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled add-ons on the device.

metrics.name: addons.has_installed_addons
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has installed add-ons on the device.

metrics.name: addons.installed_addons
metrics.description: A list of all installed add-ons on the device.

metrics.name: browser.search.ad_clicks
metrics.description:
Records clicks of adverts on SERP pages.
The key format is `<provider-name>`.

metrics.name: browser.search.in_content
metrics.description: Records the type of interaction a user has on SERP pages.

metrics.name: browser.search.with_ads
metrics.description:
Records counts of SERP pages with adverts displayed.
The key format is `<provider-name>`.

metrics.name: contextual_menu.long_press_tapped
metrics.description: Text selection contextual menu option tapped.

metrics.name: engine.kill_background_age
metrics.description:
Measures the age of the engine session of a background tab at the
time its content process got killed.

metrics.name: engine.kill_foreground_age
metrics.description:
Measures the age of the engine session of a foreground (selected) tab
at the time its content process got killed.

metrics.name: engine.tab_kills
metrics.description:
How often was the content process of a foreground (selected) or
background tab killed.

metrics.name: engine_tab.kill_background_age
metrics.description:
Measures the age of the engine session of a background tab at the
time its content process got killed.

metrics.name: engine_tab.kill_foreground_age
metrics.description:
Measures the age of the engine session of a foreground (selected) tab
at the time its content process got killed.

metrics.name: engine_tab.kills
metrics.description:
How often was the content process of a foreground (selected) or
background tab killed.

metrics.name: events.normal_and_private_uri_count
metrics.description:
A counter of URIs visited by the user in the current session, including
page reloads. This includes private browsing.  This does not include
background page requests and URIs from embedded pages but may be
incremented without user interaction by website scripts that
programmatically redirect to a new location.

metrics.name: events.total_uri_count
metrics.description:
A counter of URIs visited by the user in the current session, including
page reloads. This does not include background page requests and URIs from
embedded pages or private browsing but may be incremented without user
interaction by website scripts that programmatically redirect to a new
location.

metrics.name: experiments.metrics.active_experiment
metrics.description: Records the branch name of the active experiment, if the client is enrolled in the `fenix-test-2019-08-05` experiment. This is intended to validate that the service-experiments library properly matches clients to experiments and can take action based on a multi-branched experiment. This is done by recording the experiment branch name in this string metric which allows the experiment to be transparent and unobtrusive to the user.

metrics.name: metrics.activity_state_provider_error
metrics.description:
The `StartupActivityStateProvider...onActivityStarted` was unexpectedly
called twice. We can use this metric to validate our assumptions about
how these APIs are called. This probe can be removed once we validate
these assumptions.

metrics.name: metrics.adjust_ad_group
metrics.description:
A string containing the Adjust ad group ID from which the user installed
Fenix. This will not send on the first session the user runs. If the
install is organic, this will be empty.

metrics.name: metrics.adjust_campaign
metrics.description:
A string containing the Adjust campaign ID from which the user installed
Fenix. This will not send on the first session the user runs. If the
install is organic, this will be empty.

metrics.name: metrics.adjust_creative
metrics.description:
A string containing the Adjust creative ID from which the user installed
Fenix. This will not send on the first session the user runs. If the
install is organic, this will be empty.

metrics.name: metrics.adjust_network
metrics.description:
A string containing the Adjust network ID from which the user installed
Fenix. This will not send on the first session the user runs. If the
install is organic, this will be empty.

metrics.name: metrics.close_tab_setting
metrics.description:
A string that indicates the setting for tab closing:
MANUAL, ONE_DAY, ONE_WEEK, ONE_MONTH

metrics.name: metrics.default_browser
metrics.description: Is Fenix the default browser?

metrics.name: metrics.default_moz_browser
metrics.description:
The name of the default browser on device if and only if it's a Mozilla
owned product

metrics.name: metrics.desktop_bookmarks_count
metrics.description:
A counter that indicates how many bookmarks a user has in the desktop
folder. This value will only be set if the user has at least *one*
bookmark. If they have 0, this ping will not get sent, resulting in a
null value. To disambiguate between a failed `desktop_bookmarks_count`
ping and 0 bookmarks, please see `has_desktop_bookmarks`.

metrics.name: metrics.distribution_id
metrics.description:
A string containing the distribution identifier. This is currently used
to identify installs from Mozilla Online.

metrics.name: metrics.has_desktop_bookmarks
metrics.description: A boolean that indicates if the user has bookmarks in the desktop folder

metrics.name: metrics.has_mobile_bookmarks
metrics.description: A boolean that indicates if the user has bookmarks in the mobile folder

metrics.name: metrics.has_open_tabs
metrics.description: A boolean that indicates if the user has any open NORMAL tabs.

metrics.name: metrics.has_recent_pwas
metrics.description:
A boolean that indicates if the user has recently used PWAs.
See recently_used_pwa_count for the actual count.

metrics.name: metrics.has_top_sites
metrics.description: A boolean that indicates if the user has top sites

metrics.name: metrics.mobile_bookmarks_count
metrics.description:
A counter that indicates how many bookmarks a user has in the mobile
folder. This value will only be set if the user has at least *one*
bookmark. If they have 0, this ping will not get sent, resulting in
a null value. To disambiguate between a failed `mobile_bookmarks_count`
ping and 0 bookmarks, please see `has_mobile_bookmarks`.

metrics.name: metrics.mozilla_products
metrics.description:
A list of all the Mozilla products installed on device. We currently scan
for: Firefox, Firefox Beta, Firefox Aurora, Firefox Nightly, Firefox
Fdroid, Firefox Lite, Reference Browser, Reference Browser Debug, Fenix,
Focus, and Lockwise.

metrics.name: metrics.recently_used_pwa_count
metrics.description:
A counter that indicates how many PWAs a user has recently used.
Threshold for "recency" set in HomeActivity#PWA_RECENTLY_USED_THRESHOLD.
Currently we are not told by the OS when a PWA is removed by the user,
so we use the "recently used" heuristic to judge how many PWAs are still
active, as a proxy for "installed". This value will only be set if the
user has at least *one* recently used PWA. If they have 0, this metric
will not be sent, resulting in a null value during analysis on the
server-side. To disambiguate between a failed `recently_used_pwa_count`
metric and 0 recent PWAs, please see `has_recent_pwas`.

metrics.name: metrics.search_count
metrics.description:
The labels for this counter are `<search-engine-name>.<source>`.

If the search engine is bundled with Fenix `search-engine-name` will be
the name of the search engine. If it's a custom search engine (defined:
https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the value will be
`custom`.

`source` will be: `action`, `suggestion`, `widget`, `shortcut`, `topsite`
(depending on the source from which the search started). Also added the
`other` option for the source but it should never enter on this case.

metrics.name: metrics.search_widget_installed
metrics.description: Whether or not the search widget is installed

metrics.name: metrics.start_reason_activity_error
metrics.description:
The `AppStartReasonProvider.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks.onActivityCreated`
was unexpectedly called twice. We can use this metric to validate our
assumptions about how these APIs are called. This probe can be removed
once we validate these assumptions.

metrics.name: metrics.start_reason_process_error
metrics.description:
The `AppStartReasonProvider.ProcessLifecycleObserver.onCreate` was
unexpectedly called twice. We can use this metric to validate our
assumptions about how these APIs are called. This probe can be removed
once we validate these assumptions.

metrics.name: metrics.syncing_items
metrics.description: The preference keys for the switch preferences the user has enabled to sync with FxA. We currently track: Bookmarks and History.

metrics.name: metrics.tab_view_setting
metrics.description:
A string that indicates the setting for tab view:
GRID, LIST

metrics.name: metrics.tabs_open_count
metrics.description:
A counter that indicates how many NORMAL tabs a user has open. This
value will only be set if the user has at least *one* open tab. If they
have 0, this ping will not get sent, resulting in a null value. To
disambiguate between a failed `tabs_open_count` ping and 0 open tabs,
please see `has_open_tabs`.

metrics.name: metrics.toolbar_position
metrics.description: A string that indicates the new position of the toolbar TOP or BOTTOM

metrics.name: metrics.top_sites_count
metrics.description:
A counter that indicates how many top sites a user has. This value will
only be set if the user has at least *one* top site. If they have 0,
this ping will not get sent, resulting in a null value. To disambiguate
between a failed `top_sites_count` ping and 0 top sites, please see
`has_top_sites`.

metrics.name: metrics.total_uri_count
metrics.description: A counter of URIs visited by the user in the current session, including page reloads. This does not include background page requests and URIs from embedded pages or private browsing.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.bookmark_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a bookmarks awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.clipboard_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a clipboard awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.history_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a history awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.search_engine_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a search engine awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.session_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a session awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.shortcuts_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a shortcuts awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.awesomebar.synced_tabs_suggestions
metrics.description: Duration of a synced tabs awesomebar suggestion query.

metrics.name: perf.startup.app_on_create_to_glean_init
metrics.description:
A subsection of the duration of `FenixApplication.onCreate` and thus the
`application_on_create` probe from the start of the method through when
`initializeGlean` is called. Note: `initializeGlean` is a no-op for Beta
and Release builds which instead initialize it during
`MigratingFenixApplication`, which we don't currently measure.

metrics.name: perf.startup.app_on_create_to_megazord_init
metrics.description:
A subsection of the duration of `FenixApplication.onCreate` and thus the
`application_on_create` probe from after the `app_on_create_to_glean_init`
probe until we block for the megazord to complete set up.

metrics.name: perf.startup.app_on_create_to_setup_in_main
metrics.description:
A subsection of the duration of `FenixApplication.onCreate` and thus the
`application_on_create` probe from after the
`app_on_create_to_megazord_init` probe until the end of
`setupInMainProcessOnly`, which is expected to be the end of the
`onCreate` call (unless the implementation later changes).

metrics.name: perf.startup.application_on_create
metrics.description:
The duration of `FenixApplication.onCreate` in the main process. This does
not measure the duration of migration code (via
`MigratingFenixApplication` included in the Beta and Release channels.

metrics.name: perf.startup.base_bfragment_on_create_view
metrics.description: The duration of `BaseBrowserFragment.onCreateView`.

metrics.name: perf.startup.base_bfragment_on_view_created
metrics.description: The duration of `BaseBrowserFragment.onViewCreated`.

metrics.name: perf.startup.cold_main_app_to_first_frame
metrics.description:
The duration from `*Application`'s initializer to the first Android frame being drawn in a [COLD MAIN start up](https://wiki.mozilla.org/index.php?title=Performance/Fenix/Glossary). Notably, this duration omits the time from process start to the initializer (which includes a lengthy dex operation) and the time from the first frame to visual completeness. This probe doesn't measure Custom Tabs or other uses of `ExternalAppBrowserActivity` to simplify result analysis. The methodology for determining this measurement is imperfect to simplify implementation. Issues may include:
- Not measuring Beta and Release channels (due to `MigrationDecisionActivity` interrupting the logic).
- Not distinguishing between MAIN to homescreen, onboarding, session restore, others?
- Not choosing to record a MAIN based on what the user would see and thus the core code path (i.e. the thing we want to measure) but rather on the initial `Intent` state.

The hope is that these cases will not have a significant impact on the end results but, if they appear to, we can replace it with a more complex implementation.

Around April 8, 2021 the implementation was refactored. Functionally, it should be the same but it's noted just in case there are bugs.

metrics.name: perf.startup.cold_unknwn_app_to_first_frame
metrics.description:
The duration from `*Application`'s initializer to the first Android frame being drawn in a [COLD start up](https://wiki.mozilla.org/index.php?title=Performance/Fenix/Glossary) where we can't say it was a MAIN or VIEW start up. The methodology for determining this measurement is imperfect to simplify implementation.

See the `cold_main_app_to_first_frame` probe docs for known issues and more details.

Around April 8, 2021 the implementation was refactored. Functionally, it should be the same but it's noted just in case there are bugs.

metrics.name: perf.startup.cold_view_app_to_first_frame
metrics.description:
The duration from `*Application`'s initializer to the first Android frame being drawn in a [COLD VIEW start up](https://wiki.mozilla.org/index.php?title=Performance/Fenix/Glossary). The methodology for determining this measurement is imperfect to simplify implementation. Issues may include:
-Including VIEW intents that aren't valid so take code paths similar to MAIN (this is speculative)

See the `cold_main_app_to_first_frame` probe docs for other possible known issues and more details.

Around April 8, 2021 the implementation was refactored. Functionally, it should be the same but it's noted just in case there are bugs.

metrics.name: perf.startup.home_activity_on_create
metrics.description: The duration of `HomeActivity.onCreate`.

metrics.name: perf.startup.home_activity_on_start
metrics.description:
The duration of `HomeActivity.onStart`. This may encapsulate
`HomeFragment` or `BrowserFragment` creation, depending on the code path,
so we expect this to take varying amounts of time. As such, this probe may
not be easy to interpret directly but we believe collecting it may give us
more information about different patterns we might see in performance
data.

metrics.name: perf.startup.home_fragment_on_create_view
metrics.description: The duration of `HomeFragment.onCreateView`.

metrics.name: perf.startup.home_fragment_on_view_created
metrics.description: The duration of `HomeFragment.onViewCreated`.

metrics.name: perf.startup.startup_type
metrics.description:
Indicates how the browser was started. The label is divided into two variables. `state` is how cached the browser is when started. `path` is what code path we are expected to take. Together, they create a combined label: `state_path`. For brevity, the specific states are documented in the [Fenix perf glossary](https://wiki.mozilla.org/index.php?title=Performance/Fenix/Glossary).

This implementation is intended to be simple, not comprehensive. We list the implications below.

These ways of opening the app undesirably adds events to our primary buckets (non-`unknown` cases):
- App switcher cold/warm: `cold/warm_` + duplicates path from previous launch
- Home screen shortcuts: `*_view`
- An Intent is sent internally that's uses `ACTION_MAIN` or `ACTION_VIEW` could be: `*_main/view` (unknown if this ever happens)
- A command-line launch uses `ACTION_MAIN` or `ACTION_VIEW` could be: `*_main/view`

These ways of opening the app undesirably do not add their events to our primary buckets:
- Close and reopen the app very quickly: no event is recorded.

These ways of opening the app don't affect our primary buckets:
- App switcher hot: `hot_unknown`
- PWA (all states): `unknown_unknown`
- Custom tab: `unknown_view`
- Cold start where a service or other non-activity starts the process (not manually tested) - this seems to happen if you have the homescreen widget: `unknown_*`
- Another activity is drawn before HomeActivity (e.g. widget voice search): `unknown_*`
- Widget text search: `*_unknown`

In addition to the events above, the `unknown` state may be chosen when we were unable to determine a cause due to implementation details or the API was used incorrectly. We may be able to record the events listed above into different buckets but we kept the implementation simple for now.

N.B.: for implementation simplicity, we duplicate the logic in app that determines `path` so it's not perfectly accurate. In one way, we record we is intended to happen rather than what actually happened (e.g. the user may click a link so we record VIEW but the app does a MAIN by going to the homescreen because the link was invalid).

metrics.name: preferences.accessibility_services
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has touch exploration or switch services enabled. These are built into the Android OS, not Fenix prefs. default: ""

metrics.name: preferences.bookmarks_suggestion
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled bookmark search suggestions default: true

metrics.name: preferences.browsing_history_suggestion
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled browsing history suggestions. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.clipboard_suggestions_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled clipboard search suggestions. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.enhanced_tracking_protection
metrics.description: What type of enhanced tracking protection the user has enabled. "standard," "strict," "custom," or "" (if disabled) default: "standard"

metrics.name: preferences.open_links_in_a_private_tab
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled open links in a private tab. default: false

metrics.name: preferences.open_links_in_app
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has the open links in apps feature enabled. default: false

metrics.name: preferences.open_links_in_app_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has the open links in apps feature enabled. default: false

metrics.name: preferences.open_links_in_private
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled open links in a private tab. default: false

metrics.name: preferences.private_search_suggestions
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled showing search suggestions in private mode. default: false (we prompt the user, asking them to make a selection)

metrics.name: preferences.remote_debugging
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has remote debugging enabled default: false

metrics.name: preferences.remote_debugging_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has remote debugging enabled default: false

metrics.name: preferences.search_bookmarks
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled bookmark search suggestions default: true

metrics.name: preferences.search_browsing_history
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled browsing history suggestions. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.search_shortcuts_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled search shortcuts. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.search_suggestions_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has search suggestions enabled default: true

metrics.name: preferences.search_suggestions_private
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled showing search suggestions in private mode. default: false (we prompt the user, asking them to make a selection)

metrics.name: preferences.show_clipboard_suggestions
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled clipboard search suggestions. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.show_search_shortcuts
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled search shortcuts. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.show_search_suggestions
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has search suggestions enabled default: true

metrics.name: preferences.show_voice_search
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled the voice search button. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.signed_in_sync
metrics.description: Whether or not the user is signed into FxA default: false

metrics.name: preferences.sync
metrics.description: Whether or not the user is signed into FxA default: false

metrics.name: preferences.sync_items
metrics.description: The list of items the user has chosen to sync with FxA. default: "" if the user is signed out. Otherwise defaults to whatever is set in their FxA account. New accounts set: [bookmarks, history, passwords, tabs]

metrics.name: preferences.telemetry
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has telemetry enabled. Note we should never receive a "false" value for this since telemetry would not send in that case. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.telemetry_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has telemetry enabled. Note we should never receive a "false" value for this since telemetry would not send in that case. default: true

metrics.name: preferences.theme
metrics.description: The theme the user has enabled. "light," "dark," "system," or "battery" default: "system" for API 28+, else "light"

metrics.name: preferences.toolbar_position
metrics.description: The position of the toolbar default: bottom (defaults to top if the user has accessibility services)

metrics.name: preferences.toolbar_position_setting
metrics.description: The position of the toolbar default: bottom (defaults to top if the user has accessibility services)

metrics.name: preferences.tracking_protection
metrics.description: What type of enhanced tracking protection the user has enabled. "standard," "strict," "custom," or "" (if disabled) default: "standard"

metrics.name: preferences.user_theme
metrics.description: The theme the user has enabled. "light," "dark," "system," or "battery" default: "system" for API 28+, else "light"

metrics.name: preferences.voice_search_enabled
metrics.description: Whether or not the user has enabled the voice search button. default: true

metrics.name: search.default_engine.code
metrics.description:
If the search engine is pre-loaded with Fenix this value
will be the search engine identifier. If it's a custom search engine
(defined: https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the
value will be "custom"

metrics.name: search.default_engine.name
metrics.description:
If the search engine is pre-loaded with Fenix this value
will be the search engine name. If it's a custom search engine
(defined: https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the
value will be "custom"

metrics.name: search.default_engine.submission_url
metrics.description:
If the search engine is pre-loaded with Fenix this value will be he base
URL we use to build the search query for the search engine. For example:
https://mysearchengine.com/?query=%s. If it's a custom search engine
(defined: https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/1607) the value
will be "custom"

metrics.name: storage.stats.app_bytes
metrics.description: The size of the app's APK and related files as installed: this is expected to be larger than download size. This is the output of [StorageStats.getAppBytes](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/usage/StorageStats#getAppBytes()) so see that for details. This value is only available on Android 8+. A similar value may be available on the Google Play dashboard: we can use this value to see if that value is reliable enough.

metrics.name: storage.stats.cache_bytes
metrics.description: The size of all cached data in the app. This is the output of [StorageStats.getCacheBytes](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/usage/StorageStats#getCacheBytes()) so see that for details. This value is only available on Android 8+.

metrics.name: storage.stats.data_dir_bytes
metrics.description: The size of all data minus `cache_bytes`. This is the output of [StorageStats.getDataBytes](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/usage/StorageStats#getDataBytes()) except we subtract the value of `cache_bytes` so the cache is not measured redundantly; see that method for details. This value is only available on Android 8+.

metrics.name: storage.stats.query_stats_duration
metrics.description: How long it took to query the device for the StorageStats that contain the file size information. The docs say it may be expensive so we want to ensure it's not too expensive.  This value is only available on Android 8+.

metrics.name: app_build
metrics.description:
The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A").
For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value,
(e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier
can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other
language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration,
this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: app_channel
metrics.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

metrics.name: app_display_version
metrics.description:
The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").

In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved,
it is set to "inaccessible".

metrics.name: architecture
metrics.description: The architecture of the device, (e.g. "arm", "x86").

metrics.name: client_id
metrics.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

metrics.name: device_manufacturer
metrics.description:
The manufacturer of the device the application is running on.
Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: device_model
metrics.description:
The model of the device the application is running on.
On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name,
like "Pixel 2 XL".
Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: first_run_date
metrics.description: The date of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.database.size
metrics.description: The size of the database file at startup.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_label
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_overflow
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_state
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_value
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.io
metrics.description:
The number of times we encountered an IO error
when writing a pending ping to disk.

metrics.name: glean.error.preinit_tasks_overflow
metrics.description:
The number of tasks queued in the pre-initialization buffer.
Only sent if the buffer overflows.

metrics.name: glean.error.preinit_tasks_timeout
metrics.description: Set to true if the tasks that are queued prior to Glean initialization time out.

metrics.name: glean.time.invalid_timezone_offset
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times we encountered an invalid timezone offset
when trying to get the current time.
A timezone offset is invalid if it is outside [-24h, +24h].
If invalid a UTC offset is used (+0h).

metrics.name: glean.upload.deleted_pings_after_quota_hit
metrics.description:
The number of pings deleted after the quota
for the size of the pending pings directory or number of files is hit.
Since quota is only calculated for the pending pings directory,
and deletion request ping live in a different directory,
deletion request pings are never deleted.

metrics.name: glean.upload.discarded_exceeding_pings_size
metrics.description: The size of pings that exceeded the maximum ping size allowed for upload.

metrics.name: glean.upload.pending_pings
metrics.description:
The total number of pending pings at startup.
This does not include deletion-request pings.

metrics.name: glean.upload.pending_pings_directory_size
metrics.description:
The size of the pending pings directory upon initialization of Glean.
This does not include the size of the deletion request pings directory.

metrics.name: glean.upload.ping_upload_failure
metrics.description:
Counts the number of ping upload failures, by type of failure.
This includes failures for all ping types,
though the counts appear in the next successfully sent `metrics` ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.first_run_hour
metrics.description: The hour of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.validation.foreground_count
metrics.description: On mobile, the number of times the application went to foreground.

metrics.name: glean.validation.pings_submitted
metrics.description:
A count of the pings submitted, by ping type.

This metric appears in both the metrics and baseline pings.

- On the metrics ping, the counts include the number of pings sent since
  the last metrics ping (including the last metrics ping)
- On the baseline ping, the counts include the number of pings send since
  the last baseline ping (including the last baseline ping)

metrics.name: locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: os
metrics.description:
The name of the operating system.
Possible values:
Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows,
FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

metrics.name: os_version
metrics.description:
The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the
version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: ping_reason
metrics.description:
The optional reason the ping was submitted.
The specific values for reason are specific to each ping, and are
documented in the ping's pings.yaml file.

metrics.name: logins_store.read_query_count
metrics.description: The total number of read operations performed on the logins store. The count only includes operations triggered by the application, not e.g. incidental reads performed as part of a sync. It is intended to be used together with `read_query_error_count` to measure the overall error rate of read operations on the logins store.

metrics.name: logins_store.read_query_error_count
metrics.description: The total number of errors encountered during read operations on the logins store, labeled by type. It is intended to be used together with `read_query_count` to measure the overall error rate of read operations on the logins store.

metrics.name: logins_store.read_query_time
metrics.description: The time taken to execute a read query on the logins store (such as listing all logins, or finding a specific login by id).

metrics.name: logins_store.unlock_count
metrics.description: The number of times the login store was unlocked. It is intended to be used together with `unlock_error_count` to measure the overall error rate of unlocking the logins store.

metrics.name: logins_store.unlock_error_count
metrics.description: The number of errors encountered when unlocking the logins store, labeled by type. It is intended to be used together with `unlock_count` to measure the overall error rate of unlocking the logins store.

metrics.name: logins_store.unlock_time
metrics.description: The time taken to open the logins store on startup, or after locking it due to user inactivity.

metrics.name: logins_store.write_query_count
metrics.description: The total number of write operations performed on the logins store. The count only includes operations triggered by the application, not e.g. incidental writes performed as part of a sync. It is intended to be used together with `write_query_error_count` to measure the overall error rate of write operations on the logins store.

metrics.name: logins_store.write_query_error_count
metrics.description: The total number of errors encountered during write operations on the logins store, labeled by type. It is intended to be used together with `write_query_count` to measure the overall error rate of write operations on the logins store.

metrics.name: logins_store.write_query_time
metrics.description: The time taken to execute a write query on the logins store (such as adding, updating, or deleting a login record).

metrics.name: avif.aom_decode_error
metrics.description: Image-decode Error from AOM decoder

metrics.name: avif.bit_depth
metrics.description: Bits per pixel of AVIF image.

metrics.name: avif.dav1d_decode_error
metrics.description: Image-decode Error from dav1d decoder

metrics.name: avif.decode_result
metrics.description: Decode result of AVIF image.

metrics.name: avif.decoder
metrics.description: Decoder of AVIF image.

metrics.name: avif.yuv_color_space
metrics.description: YUV color space of AVIF image.

metrics.name: geckoview.build_id
metrics.description: The Buildid of the Gecko engine, example: 20200205124310

metrics.name: geckoview.content_process_lifetime
metrics.description: The uptime of content processes in ms

metrics.name: geckoview.document_site_origins
metrics.description: When a document is loaded, report the number of [site origins](https://searchfox.org/ mozilla-central/rev/ 3300072e993ae05d50d5c63d815260367eaf9179/ caps/nsIPrincipal.idl#264) of the entire browser if it has been at least 5 minutes since last time we collect this data.

metrics.name: geckoview.page_load_progress_time
metrics.description: Time between page load progress starts (0) and completion (100).

metrics.name: geckoview.page_load_time
metrics.description: The time taken to load a page. This includes all static contents, no dynamic content. Loading of about: pages is not counted. Back back navigation (sometimes via BFCache) is included which is a source of bimodality due to the <50ms load times.

metrics.name: geckoview.page_reload_time
metrics.description: Time taken to reload a page. This includes all static contents, no dynamic content. Loading of about: pages is not counted.

metrics.name: geckoview.per_document_site_origins
metrics.description: When a document is unloaded, report the highest number of [site origins](https://searchfox.org/ mozilla-central/rev/ 3300072e993ae05d50d5c63d815260367eaf9179/ caps/nsIPrincipal.idl#264) loaded simultaneously in that document.

metrics.name: geckoview.startup_runtime
metrics.description: The time taken to initialize GeckoRuntime.

metrics.name: geckoview.version
metrics.description: The version of the Gecko engine, example: 74.0a1

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.description
metrics.description: Long form description of the Graphics adapter

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.device_id
metrics.description: Graphics adapter device identification

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.device_id_last_seen
metrics.description: Graphics adapter device identification last seen This is a temporary workaround for some early telemetry system issues. See Bug 1601091 for more information

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.driver_date
metrics.description: Graphics adapter driver date

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.driver_files
metrics.description: List of graphics adapter driver files

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.driver_vendor
metrics.description: Graphics adapter driver vendor identification

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.driver_version
metrics.description: Graphics adapter driver version

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.ram
metrics.description: Graphics adapter dedicated memory

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.subsystem_id
metrics.description: Graphics adapter subsystem identification

metrics.name: gfx.adapter.primary.vendor_id
metrics.description: Graphics adapter vendor identification

metrics.name: gfx.checkerboard.duration
metrics.description: The duration of a checkerboard event. Checkerboarding is when painting has not kept up with asynchronous panning and zooming so the compositor has to display a "checkerboard pattern" (or in practice, the background color) rather than the actual page content.

metrics.name: gfx.checkerboard.peak_pixel_count
metrics.description: The peak number of CSS pixels that checkerboarded during a checkerboard event. The minimum value of the largest histogram bucket is the size of a 4k display with maximum APZ zooming.

metrics.name: gfx.checkerboard.potential_duration
metrics.description: The total amount of time that we could reasonably be checkerboarding. This is the union of two possibly-intersecting sets of time periods: The first set is that in which checkerboarding was actually happening, since by definition it could potentially be happening. The second set is that in which the APZC is actively transforming content in the compositor, since it could potentially transform it so as to display checkerboarding to the user. Combined with other information, this allows us to meaningfully say how frequently users actually enncounters checkerboarding.

metrics.name: gfx.checkerboard.severity
metrics.description: An opaque measurement of the severity of a checkerboard event. This doesn't have units, it's just useful for comparing two checkerboard events to see which one is worse, for some implementation-specific definition of "worse". The larger the value, the worse the checkerboarding.

metrics.name: gfx.composite_time
metrics.description: The time taken to composite a frame. On non-webrender this is the time taken in `CompositorBridgeParent::CompositeToTarget()`. On webrender, this is the time taken from the start of `WebRenderBridgeParent::CompositeToTarget()`, until the render thread has rendered the frame (in `RenderThread::HandleFrameOneDoc()`).

metrics.name: gfx.content.frame_time.from_paint
metrics.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor.

metrics.name: gfx.content.frame_time.from_vsync
metrics.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from the vsync that started a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor.

metrics.name: gfx.content.frame_time.reason
metrics.description: The reason that `gfx.content.frame_time.from_paint` recorded a slow (>200ms) result, if any.

metrics.name: gfx.content.frame_time.with_svg
metrics.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor, for frames that contained an SVG to be drawn by webrender.

metrics.name: gfx.content.frame_time.without_resource_upload
metrics.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor by webrender, excluding time spent uploading resources.

metrics.name: gfx.content.frame_time.without_upload
metrics.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor by webrender, excluding time spent uploading any content.

metrics.name: gfx.content.full_paint_time
metrics.description: Time spent in the full paint pipeline for content until it's ready for composition. For non-webrender this includes `paint_time`, plus rasterization if OMTP is enabled. For webrender, this includes `paint_time`, plus scene building time.

metrics.name: gfx.content.paint_time
metrics.description: Time spent in the main-thread paint pipeline for content. For non-webrender, this includes display list building, layer building, and when OMTP is disabled, rasterization. For webrender, this includes display list building, and webrender display list building.

metrics.name: gfx.display.count
metrics.description: Amount of displays connected to the device

metrics.name: gfx.display.primary_height
metrics.description: Height of the primary display, takes device rotation into account.

metrics.name: gfx.display.primary_width
metrics.description: Width of the primary display, takes device rotation into account.

metrics.name: gfx.feature.webrender
metrics.description: Whether webrender is enabled or disabled, and why.

metrics.name: gfx.scroll_present_latency
metrics.description: Time between receiving a scroll event on the event loop and compositing its result onto the screen (ms).

metrics.name: gfx.status.compositor
metrics.description: Name of the graphics compositor in use. Possible values are "opengl, d3d11, client, webrender or basic"

metrics.name: gfx.status.compositor_last_seen
metrics.description: Name of the graphics compositor last seen in use. Possible values are "opengl, d3d11, client, webrender or basic" This is a temporary workaround for some early telemetry system issues. See Bug 1601091 for more information

metrics.name: gfx.status.framebuild_time
metrics.description: The time taken to build a webrender frame. This involves calculating the visibility of primitives, requesting resources, and building the render passes which will be used to render the frame.

metrics.name: gfx.status.headless
metrics.description: Boolean indicated whether graphics is running in headless (no display) mode

metrics.name: gfx.status.last_compositor_gecko_version
metrics.description: The gecko version at the last time a compositor was initialized, and therefore when gfx_status_compositor was last updated. Due to gfx_status_compositor's user lifetime we see lots of unexpected values for the current gecko version. We believe this is because the user has not opened a tab since they were updated to a version where webrender should be enabled on their device. This can be used to verify that theory.

metrics.name: gfx.status.sceneswap_time
metrics.description: The time taken to do a webrender scene swap. This is book-keeping that APZ must perform once webrender has built a new scene.

metrics.name: gfx.webrender.framebuild_time
metrics.description: The time taken to build a webrender frame. This involves calculating the visibility of primitives, requesting resources, and building the render passes which will be used to render the frame.

metrics.name: gfx.webrender.render_time
metrics.description: The time taken to build a webrender frame. This involves calculating the visibility of primitives, requesting resources, and building the render passes which will be used to render the frame.

metrics.name: gfx.webrender.scenebuild_time
metrics.description: The time taken to build a webrender scene. This occurs each time webrender receives a new display list. This additionally includes blob rasterization time.

metrics.name: gfx.webrender.sceneswap_time
metrics.description: The time taken to do a webrender scene swap. This is book-keeping that APZ must perform once webrender has built a new scene.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.compact_time
metrics.description: The time spent in the compact phase.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.mark_roots_time
metrics.description: The time spent marking GC roots.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.mark_time
metrics.description: The time spent in the mark phase.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.minor_time
metrics.description: The time taked by a minor (nursery) collection.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.prepare_time
metrics.description: The time spent in the preparation phase.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.slice_time
metrics.description: The time spent running a GC slice.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.sweep_time
metrics.description: The time spent in the sweep phase.

metrics.name: javascript.gc.total_time
metrics.description: The total time taken by a major collection.

metrics.name: js.baseline_compile_percentage
metrics.description: Percentage of execution time spent during Baseline compilation for JS scripts up until the page load event fires.

metrics.name: js.bytecode_caching_time
metrics.description: Time spent caching JS bytecode for scripts executed during a page load.

metrics.name: js.delazification_percentage
metrics.description: Percentage of execution time spent during delazification for JS scripts up until the page load event fires.

metrics.name: js.execution_percentage
metrics.description: Percentage of page load time spent executing Javascript.

metrics.name: js.xdr_encode_percentage
metrics.description: Percentage of execution time spent during XDR encoding for JS scripts up until the page load event fires.

metrics.name: media.audio.backend
metrics.description: The operating system audio backend

metrics.name: media.audio.init_failure
metrics.description: Failure occurs when initializing the audio stream.

metrics.name: media.audio_init_failure
metrics.description: Failure occurs when initializing the audio stream.

metrics.name: network.cache_hit_time
metrics.description: Time to open existing cache entry file.

metrics.name: network.dns_end
metrics.description: In the HTTP page channel, time from the DNS request being issued to the response.

metrics.name: network.dns_start
metrics.description: In the HTTP page channel, time from connection open to the DNS request being issued.

metrics.name: network.first_from_cache
metrics.description: In the HTTP page channel, time from connection open to cache read start.

metrics.name: network.font_download_end
metrics.description: Time after navigationStart that all webfont downloads are completed.

metrics.name: network.tcp_connection
metrics.description: In the HTTP page channel, time from the TCP SYN packet is received to the connection is established and ready for HTTP.

metrics.name: network.tls_handshake
metrics.description: In the HTTP page channel, time from after the TCP SYN packet is received to the secure connection is established and ready for HTTP.

metrics.name: performance.interaction.keypress_present_latency
metrics.description: Time between receiving a keypress event in the event loop and compositing its result onto the screen.

metrics.name: performance.interaction.mouseup_click_present_latency
metrics.description: Time between receiving a mouseup which follow by a mouseclick on the event loop and compositing its result onto the screen.

metrics.name: performance.interaction.tab_switch_composite
metrics.description: Time between tab selection and first composite of the tab content onto the screen.

metrics.name: performance.page.non_blank_paint
metrics.description: The time between navigationStart and the first non-blank paint of a foreground root content document, in milliseconds. This only records documents that were in an active docshell throughout the whole time between navigation start and non-blank paint. The non-blank paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.

metrics.name: performance.page.total_content_page_load
metrics.description: Time to load all of a page's resources and render.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.dcl
metrics.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domContentLoaded for the foreground http or https root content document.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.dcl_responsestart
metrics.description: Time in milliseconds from responseStart to domContentLoaded for the foreground http or https root content document.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.fcp
metrics.description: The time between navigationStart and the first contentful paint of a foreground http or https root content document, in milliseconds. The contentful paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.fcp_responsestart
metrics.description: The time between responseStart and the first contentful paint of a foreground http or https root content document, in milliseconds. The contentful paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.load_time
metrics.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to loadEventStart for the foreground http or https root content document.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.load_time_responsestart
metrics.description: Time in milliseconds from responseStart to loadEventStart for the foreground http or https root content document.

metrics.name: performance.pageload.req_anim_frame_callback
metrics.description: Time spent in milliseconds calling all request animation frame callbacks for a document before it has reached readystate complete.

metrics.name: performance.responsiveness.req_anim_frame_callback
metrics.description: Time spent in milliseconds calling all request animation frame callbacks for a document after it has reached readystate complete.

metrics.name: performance.time.dom_complete
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to domComplete as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: performance.time.dom_content_loaded_end
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to domContentLoadedEventEnd as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: performance.time.dom_content_loaded_start
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to domContentLoadedEventStart as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: performance.time.dom_interactive
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to domInteractive as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: performance.time.load_event_end
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to loadEventEnd as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: performance.time.load_event_end_no_preload
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to [`loadEventEnd`](https://www.w3.org/TR/ navigation-timing/#dom-performancetiming-loadend) as per the W3C Performance Timing API. This is only submitted on when the document would not preload a resource.

metrics.name: performance.time.load_event_end_preload
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to [`loadEventEnd`](https://www.w3.org/TR/ navigation-timing/#dom-performancetiming-loadend) as per the W3C Performance Timing API. This is only submitted on when the document would preload a resource (i.e., if it encounters a `<link>` element or a `Link` header with `rel="preload"`), even if the `network.preload` pref is disabled.

metrics.name: performance.time.load_event_start
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to loadEventStart as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: performance.time.load_event_start_no_preload
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to [`loadEventStart`](https://www.w3.org/TR/ navigation-timing/#dom-performancetiming-loadstart) as per the W3C Performance Timing API. This is only submitted on when the document would not preload a resource.

metrics.name: performance.time.load_event_start_preload
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to [`loadEventStart`](https://www.w3.org/TR/ navigation-timing/#dom-performancetiming-loadstart) as per the W3C Performance Timing API. This is only submitted on when the document would preload a resource (i.e., if it encounters a `<link>` element or a `Link` header with `rel="preload"`), even if the `network.preload` pref is disabled.

metrics.name: performance.time.response_start
metrics.description: Time from navigationStart to responseStart as per the W3C Performance Timing API.

metrics.name: crash_metrics.crash_count
metrics.description:
Counts the number of crashes that occur in the application. This measures only the counts of each crash in association with the labeled type of the crash. The labels correspond to the types of crashes handled by lib-crash.
Deprecated: `native_code_crash` replaced by `fatal_native_code_crash` and `nonfatal_native_code_crash`

metrics.name: places_manager.read_query_count
metrics.description: The total number of read operations performed on the places store. The count only includes operations triggered by the application, not e.g. incidental reads performed as part of a sync. It is intended to be used together with `read_query_error_count` to measure the overall error rate of read operations on the places store.

metrics.name: places_manager.read_query_error_count
metrics.description: The total number of errors encountered during read operations on the places store, labeled by type. It is intended to be used together with `read_query_count` to measure the overall error rate of read operations on the places store.

metrics.name: places_manager.read_query_time
metrics.description: The time taken to execute a read query on the places store.

metrics.name: places_manager.scan_query_time
metrics.description: The time taken to execute a scan query on the places store. This metric is for queries that we expect to be costly e.g. getBookmarksTree(guid, recursive=True).

metrics.name: places_manager.write_query_count
metrics.description: The total number of write operations performed on the places store. The count only includes operations triggered by the application, not e.g. incidental writes performed as part of a sync. It is intended to be used together with `write_query_error_count` to measure the overall error rate of write operations on the places store.

metrics.name: places_manager.write_query_error_count
metrics.description: The total number of errors encountered during write operations on the places store, labeled by type. It is intended to be used together with `write_query_count` to measure the overall error rate of write operations on the places store.

metrics.name: places_manager.write_query_time
metrics.description: The time taken to execute a write query on the places store.

metrics.name: android_sdk_version
metrics.description:
The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this
hardware device.

metrics.name: glean.core.migration.successful
metrics.description: Reports `true` if the client was successfully migrated from the Android-specific implementation of the Glean SDK to the cross-platform one.

metrics.name: glean.validation.app_forceclosed_count
metrics.description: This metric counts how many times a dirty bit was detected when starting the Glean SDK, on Android. This dirty bit is set to `true` when Android's lifecycle `ON_START` is hit and flipped back to false on `ON_STOP`. When an application is force-closed, it might not get the `ON_STOP` and so the value would stay `true`. The next time Glean starts, it will increment this counter.

metrics.name: glean.validation.baseline_ping_count
metrics.description: The number of baseline pings sent during the lifetime of this metrics ping.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.baseline_compile_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load baseline compiling Javascript in ms.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.delazification_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load delazifying Javascript in ms.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.execution_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load executing Javascript in ms.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.gc_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load in the GC in ms.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.parse_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load syntax parsing JS scripts on the main thread in ms.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.protect_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load protecting JIT executable memory.

metrics.name: javascript.pageload.xdr_encode_time
metrics.description: Time spent during page load XDR encoding Javascript in ms.
